findings: The feature consistently activates at gene boundaries or junctions. The feature is particularly active in Spiroplasma and other bacterial genomes, suggesting a taxon-specific signal related to gene termination structures.
conclusion: This feature captures a biologically meaningful pattern associated with gene termination sites or intergenic regions following genes.
title: Gene Termination/3' End Detection Feature
description: This feature specifically detects the 3' end of genes or the intergenic regions immediately following gene termination sites. It shows consistent, sharp activation spikes precisely at these boundaries across multiple examples. The signal likely corresponds to sequence motifs associated with transcription termination, such as rho-independent terminators or other termination signal sequences. The pattern is highly consistent across examples and appears most active in bacterial genomes, particularly in Spiroplasma species. The feature may be detecting conserved sequence patterns that signal the end of transcription units, which would have important regulatory functions in determining where RNA polymerase detaches from the DNA template.
